intro: Saprosma scabrida, commonly known as the roughleaf saprosma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its rough, bark-like leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within the Rubiaceae family.
